page.title: 16PROBLEMS OF THE YOUNG 2
page.content: The nearsest form of nightlife is to be found over 6 miles away in the city of Cardiff. With Cardiff being such a large and active city the entertainment available can often turn out to be rather expensive. Young people, who are often living on very low wages, find it very hard to justify the expense of an evening out, so for most of the time they either wander about the streets or sit at home and vegitate. Unless something can be done to improve the area, in both an industrial and social sense Taffs Well could well become a ghost town. All in all, the area presents an unhappy enviroment for young people in the 1980's.
